无论您是否打算观察四旬期的基督教季节，庆祝狂欢节（或胖星期二）都是享受一些甜点的绝佳借口。过去，四旬期意味着弃权，例如黄油，糖和鸡蛋。随着基督教在全球不同地区的蔓延，在食物相对较快地宠坏的时候，在禁食的40天期间，没有希望保留这些成分的希望。与其扔全部，不如说是一场巨大的清除盛宴：一切都必须走。在这个粮食时期之后，诞生了许多创造性和放纵的零食。他们中的大多数被油炸。他们都是碳水化合物。这是庆祝一周中最胖的日子的九种精美美食。

paczki

Paczki现在在世界各地都享受着波兰的作品，它是一种蓬松的炸面团，经常装满水果果酱，就像美国果冻甜甜圈一样。 Paczki might even be filled and topped with chopped fruit, as fruit would also spoil over the fasting period, along with the other primary ingredients.它们是由富含酵母菌的面团制成的，通常包括酒精。它们将炸至金色，然后填满或弄脏或蓬松，然后用糖粉或糖霜完成。

Fastnacht

The word “ fastnacht ” refers to both the celebratory snack and the time for enjoying them–just before Lenten fasting. The German variety of fastnacht are pillowy, yeast-raised, deep-fried doughnuts that you can eat with a dollop of blackstrap molasses (which sounds like a lot of intense flavor for me, but I support your choices).宾夕法尼亚州荷兰版的Fastnacht引起了我的兴趣。该甜甜圈是由酵母饲养的土豆面团和大量黄油和糖制成的。 This recipe repurposes mashed potatoes. I also appreciate this recipe for the helpful tips on changing out the oil, and advice on definitely not using expired yeast.

半氯bun

图片来源：艾莉·钱索恩·莱因曼（Allie Chanthorn Reinmann

我讨厌向您展示一些不油炸的东西，但是这些Semlor面包太棒了，无法忽略。毛绒面包在脂肪周二的几周内在瑞典食用，毛绒面包是豆蔻味和烘烤的。将中心从烘焙和冷却的卷中雕刻出来，然后将其装满甜味的杏仁馅，然后是一堆鲜奶油。在上面放上您从中心拿出的一小部分滚动。 This recipe uses a tangzhong mixture to keep the roll soft.

海地甜菜

There are beignets, like the flour-based ones popular in New Orleans for Mardi Gras, and then there are beignets , like the ones made in Haiti with a banana-based dough.无需证明面团，只需将面糊放入油炸油中而塑造它们。 Check out this recipe for a straightforward mixing and frying method.

国王蛋糕

在美国的几个地区（但没有像新奥尔良的标志性地区），狂欢节前几天必须包括面包的这种庞然大物。国王蛋糕是一种甜美，丰富，酵母饲养的零食，覆盖有糖霜和黄色，紫色和绿色洒水。这是糖，颜色和风味的爆炸。国王蛋糕可以保持未填充，突出他们柔软的甜点般的质地，或者可以用果酱，坚果或肉桂和糖填充生面团。然后将面团编织成辫子，或者在烘烤之前扭曲并成形为圆圈。传统要求面包师将一个小的令牌（通常是一个塑料婴儿）塞入面包中。谁与婴儿一起获得了切片，下次将国王蛋糕带来。 My king cake video includes a recipe and how-to tutorial.

Hornazo de Jueves Lardero

摆脱一道菜的所有易腐烂物，从来没有比在霍纳佐中更明显或更诱人。 Hornazo de Jueves Lardero指的是您的储藏室中的食物一起烤在一起，并在星期四脂肪食用。 Usually made and enjoyed in different regions of Spain, the hornazo can be made with a sweet or savory bread depending on the locality.做出选择的面包，证明它，当您准备烘烤时，将生鸡蛋，一些腌制的香肠和一两片培根就在上面。照常烘烤。到面包已经完全烘烤时，肉和鸡蛋也会有。 You can follow this how-to video to learn how to make it.

弗雷特和di di carnevale

Italy has no shortage of dishes for celebrating the days leading up to Lent.其中包括烤宽面条和馄饨，但是如果没有一些甜炸碳水化合物，就不会庆祝。 Dolci di carnevale include such fancies as the zeppole and cicerchiata , and no Venetian carnevale is complete without fritole. Fritole are yeast-raised, fried dough fritters, bolstered with a splash of booze and studded with raisins.炸直到酥脆，用一堆糖粉粉尘。

所有的煎饼

学分：Natalia van doninck/shutterstock

在这一点上，您可能会认为“甜甜圈日”是一个名字更有意义的，但是在包括英国和爱尔兰在内的几个国家中，您可能会听到四旬期被称为“ Shrove Tureding”或“ Pancake Day”的前一天。当您考虑一下时，如果每个人都将鸡蛋，黄油，糖和面粉倾倒到碗中，那么您会得到煎饼或甜甜圈，具体取决于您在食品储藏室中剩下的发酵剂。 Shrove Tuesday煎饼比您可能习惯的蓬松圆盘要瘦一些，但比法国薄饼稍微笨重。 Try this recipe, which makes the batter easy to prepare with the help of a blender.

艾尔·贝尔斯（Alle Belles）

周二在印度果阿州，对煎饼的传统放纵，艾尔·贝尔斯（Alle Belles）的外观像薄饼一样，但没有鸡蛋。考虑到最近的鸡蛋价格，这可能是您的煎饼。馅料是震惊的。 Alle belles pancakes are wrapped around a filling of chopped coconut, cashews, and jaggery .当它坐在温暖的煎饼中时，填充物会略微变软，提供精致的甜味和质地和谐。 Try this recipe, which yields about 10 pancakes.

设置免费的电子邮件帐户从未如此简单。现在，您有很多不错的选择，可以保证很多存储或方便的功能，尽管在选择该功能时需要牢记一些事情。经验法则是，如果您获得了免费的电子邮件服务，则可能是您的隐私付款，因为公司必须在一天结束时赚钱。根据公司的不同，它可以使用您的电子邮件为广告提供服务，在网络上跟踪您，甚至使用电子邮件中的文本培训AI。但是，该规则有例外，特别是在端到端加密方面。

这是一个艰难的平衡。通常，您必须支付真实的钱才能避免妥协 - 专注于隐私的服务可能会遭受其他地方的影响。 But if you're not ready to pay or set up your own private email server yet , here are your best free alternatives. You're not even limited to one option—it's a good idea to create multiple email accounts and use them for different purposes , so you should mix and match based on your needs.

Gmail是大多数人的最佳电子邮件提供商

学分：Pranay Parab

Gmail is the best email service for most people, hands down.它是可靠的，可以很好地过滤垃圾邮件，并免费为您提供15GB的云文件存储。另外，这实际上是不可避免的。很难上网并完全避免使用Google，在某个时候，您可能需要一个Google帐户。从设置大多数Android手机到访问共享的Google文档，Gmail都为广泛的观众提供了很好的服务。

Your Gmail account also comes with unlimited addresses , which is a great way to check if a service sold your email ID to spammers.反对Gmail的最大论点是它归Google拥有，该公司通过在线跟踪您来帮助您在其他地方看到的广告来赚钱。如果您是隐私意识的，那么这不是适合您的正确电子邮件服务。

Pros: Ubiquitous, easy to use, feature-rich, integrates with other Google products
Cons: Lots of advertising based on mining your data

对于大多数人来说，前景是最好的Gmail替代品

学分：Pranay Parab

For those who don't want to use Gmail, but are looking for a similar service, Microsoft's Outlook is the best option. Just like Gmail, Outlook is backed by a tech giant and will almost certainly be around for years to come.另外，您可以免费获得多达15GB的电子邮件存储空间和5GB的额外的OneDrive存储空间。这是Gmail的可靠替代方法，但是如果隐私是您的首要任务，则不是您要使用的电子邮件服务。

Pros: Backed by a major tech company;功能丰富的Gmail替代品
Cons: Like Google, Microsoft doesn't care that much about your privacy

Proton Mail是最佳隐私电子邮件服务

学分：Pranay Parab

Proton Mail is the best free email service for privacy-conscious people.它提供1GB的存储空间，每天限制150封电子邮件，并免费免费使用10个别名，这足以开始使用。我的Gmail帐户已有十多年的历史，并且仍然使用不到1GB的存储空间，因此可以使用该存储限制来管理一段时间。即使您不花一毛钱，Proton Mail也为您提供了比邮件相当多的东西。 You'll get a free VPN for one device and a free password manager as well.

Proton Mail的最大优势是端到端加密，这意味着您的消息不能被Proton Mail或第三方截获或阅读。只要您与Proton Mail用户或使用其他端到端加密电子邮件提供商进行沟通，这是一项很棒的隐私功能，但是如果您在广告支持的电子邮件帐户上与人们进行沟通，则不会有效。一切都可能完全是私人的，但是朋友的电子邮件服务可以轻松阅读您的电子邮件中的内容。 If you're ready to pay, Proton Unlimited offers great value with more email addresses, more storage space, and advanced privacy features like dark web monitoring.

Pros: Great for privacy;端到端加密
Cons: Only 1GB of storage and a daily sending limit

TUTA还是一个以隐私为中心的电子邮件提供商

学分：Pranay Parab

If you need an encrypted email service that offers open-source desktop clients, Tuta could be one to consider.它具有1GB存储空间和没有广告的免费层，这也是一个加号。尽管图塔（Tuta）是端到端加密的，但您的隐私取决于您正在发送电子邮件的人的加密状态。就像质子邮件一样，电子邮件加密也需要船上的所有各方，即使一个人正在使用未加密的服务，您的隐私也会受到损害。图塔（Tuta）在免费层中带有一个日历，但是如果要设置多个日历，则必须付款。

一件好事是图塔（Tuta）不限制您每天可以发送或接收多少电子邮件。唯一的限制是存储。您还可以获得用于移动使用的应用程序。

Pros : Encryption, privacy, and no sending limits
Cons : Just 1GB storage

Yahoo邮件是免费存储的最佳免费电子邮件

图片来源：乔尔·坎宁安（Joel Cunningham）

If you want the maximum possible storage on your free email account, believe it or not, Yahoo Mail is your best bet.提供商可免费使用1TB存储（是的，是1,000GB）。收集到的是，它仍然会限制您每封电子邮件最多25MB附件，因此您无法开始将4K电影附加到电子邮件中。它还带有其他有用的功能，例如退订新闻通讯的简便方法。但是，Yahoo邮件还向您展示了收件箱中的广告，如果您担心隐私，并不是真正要使用的服务。

Pros: Tons of free storage
Cons: As ad-heavy and invasive as other services, plus you have to have an “@yahoo” or, worse, “@aol” email address. (Certain people will judge you, if only subconsciously.)

iCloud邮件最容易为Apple用户设置

学分：Pranay Parab

For anyone who already has an Apple Account, setting up aniCloud Mail account is really easy.转到设备的设置并点击您的名字。 Then, click or tap through to iCloud >; Mail , and follow the on-screen instructions to set it up.由于您已经拥有一个Apple帐户，因此您无需创建一个新密码，也可以免费开始使用该服务。 iCloud Mail的免费层提供5GB空间，并且没有广告。请注意，此5GB与您的照片，设备备份以及iCloud上的其他所有内容共享，因此有效地比您预期的要小。但是，如果您在Apple设备上，则具有不必安装任何应用程序来使用该服务的额外优势，因为您的iPhone，iPad和Mac船都使用邮件应用程序进行了预安装。

iCloud邮件也可以在Windows，Android和Web上访问。 The easiest way to use iCloud Mail on non-Apple devices is via the iCloud website , although there is an iCloud for Windows app for PC. Note that you'll still need an Apple Account for this, which you can create for free at https://account.apple.com/ .

对于Android，您也可以轻松地将iCloud邮件添加到手机的邮件应用程序中。 Log in to your Apple Account here and select App-specific passwords .创建一个新密码并保存以供以后使用。将新帐户添加到您喜欢的电子邮件应用程序，选择IMAP选项，然后键入您的iCloud电子邮件ID和专用密码。这会将电子邮件ID添加到您的Android手机中。

Apple的邮件应用程序会定期更新，您可以访问隐私功能，例如即使在iCloud Mail的免费层上进行保护也可以防止电子邮件跟踪。但是，尽管这项服务对许多人来说很棒，但有时这有点不合时宜。我有时未能在iCloud邮件上收到一些电子邮件，因为它们被标记为垃圾邮件，并且从未降落在我的收件箱中。从好的方面来说，您可以将三个别名添加到iCloud邮件中，如果您想保护实际的电子邮件地址免于受到损害，那很好。

Pros : Easy set up, three aliases for free
Cons : Occasionally buggy, just 5GB of free space (shared with iCloud Photos and your device backups)

AOL是无限存储的最佳免费电子邮件

学分：丹尼尔·奥罗佩扎（Daniel Oropeza）

Another throwback, AOL Mail , offers a lot of the same benefits as Yahoo Mail, with a similar feature set and size limits (they're owned by the same company). AOL是用户友好的，可让您组织和个性化收件箱，并在大多数电子邮件客户端具有的功能上提供拼写检查，日历和待办事项列表功能。它与Android和iOS应用程序兼容，您可以从CSV，TXT或LDIF文件传输联系人列表。

Pros: Unlimited free storage
Cons: You're limited to 25 MB for your email attachments

zoho邮件让您免费使用自定义的电子邮件地址域

学分：Pranay Parab

几乎每个免费电子邮件提供商的最大问题是您无法控制与电子邮件地址关联的域名。您将被 @gmail.com， @yahoo.com， @outlook.com等结束的电子邮件地址所困扰。

If you want to use your own domain name with your free email, check out Zoho Mail .它的免费计划使您可以将多达五个用户添加到您的帐户中，并提供每个用户的5GB免费存储空间。没有广告，但是您不会获得移动应用程序的IMAP或POP3同步功能，这意味着接收新电子邮件的移动通知可能会延迟。该服务在桌面浏览器上仍然可以很好地工作。

Pros: You can use a custom @
Cons: Only 5GB storage and no IMAP or POP3 syncing

Neo是小企业主的最佳免费电子邮件

学分：丹尼尔·奥罗佩扎（Daniel Oropeza）

Small business owners, freelancers, or anyone who wants to see how their emails are performing and how many people are actually reading them can see basic email analytic tools like CTR (click-through rate) and open rates with Neo .它也是Zoho的绝佳替代方法，因为它使您可以免费选择一个域，并且具有多达100GB的存储空间。您可以使用AI功能来编写电子邮件，但是您没有像Zoho上的五个用户帐户。但是，如果您遇到麻烦，请警告Neo的支持并不是最好的。

Pros: See CTR and Open rates
Cons: The support isn't very responsive

; https://lifehacker.com/tech/tp-link-tapo-security-camera-sale?utm_medium=rss Pradershika SharmaTech 指定一个“炼狱”盒，以减轻压力的整理1850268872 Thu, 27 Feb 2025 15:00:00 +0000在您扔掉东西之前，尝试将其视而不见。

即使您不是完全ho积，摆脱东西也可能很难。 It's hard enough for so many of us in our consumerist society, in fact, that scientists have studied why that is —and are always coming up with ways to overcome an aversion to decluttering our lives. Just in time for spring cleaning season, look to research published in the Journal of Consumer Psychology that suggests there's a way to ease yourself into parting with old belongings: Instead of throwing them out all at once, banish them to purgatory first.

将杂物放入“炼狱”中意味着什么

The researchers, Mathew S. Isaac and Poornima Vinoo, kicked off their paper by explaining that people who struggle to part with their possessions tend to jump through hoops to avoid doing it and may only manage to do so by employing “ various behavioral strategies” to ease the psychological strain.研究人员指出，事实证明对某些人有用的一种这样的策略正在降级不必要但难以零一的物品以“看不见”的状态，希望他们随后脱颖而出，以后可以被处置，减去手工挥舞。他们写道：“根据人种志研究，一种这样的策略是将产品转移到炼狱或临时的限制空间中。”

In other words: Before throwing out your old photos, books, receipts, mementos, or knick knacks for good , put them into a space somewhere between your everyday environment and the trash.从本质上讲，放逐您认为您应该摆脱不访问它们的盒子或垃圾抽屉的东西，但是您会知道它们仍然存在。 Once you no longer have to look at them every day, you'll hopefully realize how little you actually need them once it's time for a major purge, and they'll be easier to donate, sell , or trash.

为什么炼狱方法可以帮助您摆脱垃圾

艾萨克（Isaac）和维诺（Vinoo）审查了三项现有研究，这些研究表明将物品转移到“炼狱”中，有助于人们为处置的不可避免性做好准备。但是，他们的研究发现了它起作用的新原因，并且与依恋的减少无关。他们写道：“具体来说，炼狱被证明会触发产品处置过程的心理模拟，从而帮助产品所有者振作起来迫在眉睫的产品损失。”

用更简单的话来说，当您将物品谴责到其炼狱中时，这是将其扔掉的实践。您不仅会通过将它们从日常环境中删除，从而逐步减少对物理对象的依恋，而且您将在实际垃圾永久垃圾的那一刻进行排练。

如何开始将多余的东西放入炼狱中

When you're decluttering , make a separate pile of things you think you could get rid of, even if you aren't quite ready to pull the trigger yet, in addition to the clear-cut piles of things to toss, sell, donate, and keep.您不必承诺将它们全部扔掉，但这将使您思考这种可能性。您已经不再穿的过时衣服，您多年来从未拿起的一次性厨房工具，并且您的孩子已经老化了，从基本上来说，您所持有的所有东西都以感性或“以防万一”的原因，可以进入炼狱。

Make sure “purgatory” is someplace you won't have to look at every day.这个想法是忘记那里的东西，以便您可以看到它的真实意义。将盒子深到壁橱，地下室或车库的架子上。为了提高效率，请使用单独的盒子来对其他任何人都没有用的东西，以及可以合理捐赠的东西。这样一来，当他们到达最后的休息地点时，您可以将一个盒子带到捐赠中心，而不必再次经历一个盒子，这将减少您在其中任何东西抛弃任何东西的可能性。

挑战自己不要冒险炼狱，除了将更多的东西放在那里，但是请心动知道研究表明您可能甚至不想这样做。从现在起一个月的时间里，在手机中设置一个提醒，那天，无论是垃圾还是捐赠中心，都将物品运送到最终目的地。如果您发现实际上需要在该月的包装盒中使用某些东西，则可以将其视为必要的物品。 （顺便说一句，这不太可能。）

与您不确定的事物分开的其他方法

我比任何人都知道，制造借口不摆脱混乱是多么容易。我是卫冕皇后，坚持“以防万一我需要的东西”。但是，您可以为自己拥有的一切借口做出借口。炼狱盒是弥合知道某事可能是垃圾并实际扔掉的差距的好方法，这就是为什么我有一个炼狱架子的旧衣服的原因。但是，还有其他旨在使您更容易扔掉东西的方法，而这些方法比不得不等待一个月的盒子更快。

I recommend familiarizing yourself with these decluttering questions .当您在壁橱，橱柜，醉酒的抽屉或其他任何地方进行排序时，提出客观，合理的问题是避免任何感性或借口的最简单方法之一。一些问题包括：“如果需要的话，我知道我有这个吗？”和“我上次使用它是什么时候？”重新构架您如何看待特定物品及其实用程序可以帮助您参与其中。 I used to be all about the KonMari method , which has you ask yourself if each item you pick up "sparks joy" for you, but the issue was that I could do enough mental and emotional gymnastics to claim that everything I owned sparked joy.如果您像我一样，可以切换到更僵化的（诚然，更严厉）的询问线，这可能是您需要的推动力。

If, after answering the questions about a certain item, you're still unsure whether you can give it up, toss it into the purgatory box.只要您致力于最终摆脱不为您服务的目标，实际上只是在弥补您的空间，就可以结合方法。

I'm Lifehacker's resident marathon runner and senior finance writer. And now, I'm merging my two worlds. Running is often touted as one of the most accessible sports—just lace up and go, right? But as many runners discover, what starts as a "free" activity can quickly transform into a significant investment.

After a decade of "casually" running, I looked around at my room one day and saw dollar signs: sneakers, my second pair that year, at least $100. Medals from races, some costing $250 to register. A box of energy gels for long runs, around $30. A fancy hand-held water bottle, anti-chafing sticks, high-tech cold-weather leggings—what happened to my "lace up and go" mentality?

Here's a glimpse at the true financial impact of running gear, from the bare essentials to premium options for those with deeper pockets.

What a minimalist approach to running would cost

Pun intended, of course. For those wanting to keep costs at an absolute minimum, running can indeed be approached with remarkable frugality. Here's what you truly need:

Essential gear

  • Running shoes: $60-100 (entry-level models on sale)

  • Moisture-wicking shirts: $10-15 (basic athletic tees from discount retailers)

  • Running shorts/pants: $15-20 (simple options from general sporting goods stores)

  • Socks: $5-10 (multi-pack athletic socks)

Weather necessities

  • Winter: Layer existing clothes (that cotton sweatshirt works—it's just not optimal).

  • Rain: A basic baseball cap ($10) and quick-drying clothes

  • Summer: Stick to early morning or evening runs to avoid expensive cooling gear.

Hydration & nutrition

  • Water bottle: $5-10 (basic reusable bottle)

  • Nutrition: Homemade options (banana, toast with honey, etc.)

Annual cost for the minimalist runner: $150-250

If you're a casual runner who'll only use one pair of shoes per year, this sport shouldn't break the bank. The minimalist approach is entirely valid—countless runners have logged thousands of miles with just the basics. I know I've been stubbornly minimalist through the years. In fact, this past marathon training season is the first time I really invested in some higher tech gear.

That said, I must begrudgingly report there's often a noticeable difference in comfort and performance when you invest in purpose-built equipment.

How much a practical enthusiast might spend on running

For runners with some flexibility in their budget, strategic investments in key pieces can significantly enhance the experience without breaking the bank.

Quality essentials

  • Running shoes: $120-160 (mid-tier models replaced every 300-500 miles)

  • Technical shirts: $30-45 each ( two to three quality moisture-wicking options )

  • Running-specific shorts/tights: $40-60 each

  • Performance socks: $12-18 per pair (three to four pairs)

  • Sports bras (if applicable): $40-60 each (two to three quality options)

How much a dedicated runner might spend

For devoted runners who prioritize performance, recovery, and optimization, running becomes a more significant financial commitment. Here's a look at just how expensive this sport can get, if you're willing to invest.

Performance gear

  • Multiple specialized shoes: $140-250 each (training, racing, trail options)

  • Premium apparel: Complete seasonal wardrobes ($500-1,000+ annually)

  • Compression gear: $80-150 (tights, sleeves, socks )

  • High-end rain/cold protection: $150-300 ( insulation jackets , premium thermal layers)

Technology & analytics

  • Advanced GPS watch: $300-700 ( Garmin Forerunner , COROS, etc.)

  • Additional sensors: $50-100 (heart rate straps, foot pods)

  • Training platforms: $60-120 annually (Strava premium, TrainingPeaks)

  • Recovery tools: $200-500 ( massage gun , compression boots, etc.)

  • Specialized nutrition: $50-100 monthly (premium gels, recovery drinks, supplements)

Professional coaching

  • Gait analysis: $75-150

  • Custom insoles: $200-300

  • Coaching: $100-300+ monthly

Annual cost for dedicated runner: $2,000-5,000+

Depending on race schedule and gear replacement frequency, running can transform from a simple exercise into a lifestyle with its own ecosystem of products and services. The investment can be substantial, but for those deeply committed to the sport, each element serves a purpose in enhancing performance, preventing injury, and/or improving the overall experience. If you're spending this much on running, I hope you're getting some sponsorships and brand deals in return.

Finding your balance

The beauty of running is that you can participate meaningfully at any of these investment levels. Sometimes, a strategic upgrade in one area can make a disproportionate difference in your running experience. I find I take something of a hybrid approach. Invest in truly essential items, like good shoes and proper socks, but skip unnecessary "innovations"—not every gadget improves your running!

Another cost-saving trick: Always look for last season's models. Unless you're a serious racer, there's rarely a reason to splurge on the newest, hottest watch or shoes. At the end of the day, the "right" amount to spend on running gear is highly personal. By understanding where quality truly matters versus where you can economize, you can build a running kit that supports your goals without unnecessary expense.
